page.title: 16Autosystems
page.content: Autosystems is a company that was started in 1975 and operates out of Crosland Hall. It makes special computers for poultry farms and employs 19 people.Most of the employees are men who live locally but 2 come from Leeds,1 from Manchester and one from Sheffield. The raw materials for the computer chips come from America and Japan. The finished products are exported to all E.E.C. countries,Hungary,Russia, Czechoslovakia, Yugoslavia and Australia and the U.S.A. The company designs and tests its own products and it is likely to double its production in the next 4 years. Last year it made 50 systems with the value of Â£1,500,000. Each system takes about 10 weeks to assemble. Autosystems is the only factory in Britain making this type of product.
